normalised: load shedding, essentially planned power outages, is a reality in many parts of india, especially during peak demand hours or when the electricity grid is under stress. think scorching summer days in delhi when everyone is blasting their A C s, or those diwali evenings when the whole country seems to be lit up like a christmas tree (only with diyas, obviously!). the reasons are usually a mix of insufficient generation capacity, inadequate transmission infrastructure, and, let us be honest, sometimes just plain old mismanagement.
